Module org.example.miniproyecto_3
Package org.example.miniproyecto_3.Model

Class ShipAdapter

java.lang.Object
org.example.miniproyecto_3.Model.ShipAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IShip
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ship
public abstract class ShipAdapter extends Object implements IShip
Abstract adapter class for ships in the game.

Provides default implementations for common ship behaviors such as orientation handling and sunk state. Subclasses are expected to override methods like isSunk() as needed.

This class implements the IShip interface and is extended by concrete ship classes.

See Also:

    • flip

      public void flip()
      Flips the orientation of the ship.

      If the ship is currently IShip.Orientation.HORIZONTAL, it becomes IShip.Orientation.VERTICAL, and vice versa.

      Specified by:
      flip in interface IShip

    • isSunk

      public boolean isSunk()
      Returns whether the ship has been sunk.

      By default, this implementation always returns false. Subclasses should override this method to provide actual sinking logic.

      Specified by:
      isSunk in interface IShip
      Returns:
      false always, unless overridden

    • setSunk

      Parameters:
